result.execSummary:
The defendant Abimael Trevino Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No illegal drugs or alcohol.

Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions -- Domestic Violence Court.

IT IS ORDERED: 
That a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 15 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.
Reflects 01-22-16 Court order imposing 15 days of condition time

Defendant Abimael Trevino not in court, defendant in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Condtions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed (15 days straight time).

Defendant Abimael Trevino in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Abimael Trevino in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Attorney McClure received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
Bail refund check packet.

Defendant Abimael Trevino in court with attorney Thomas J. McClure.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS, with credit for 301 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 30 deays  in the House of Correction, STAYED until next court date.
-Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete a Batterer's Intervention Program.
-Complete a parenting class.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random screens.
-No Contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of child visitation as approved by the agent and children's court orders.
-Possess no firearms.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment as able.
-Obtain GED or HSED.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
